channel.title: Highscores on website
channel.description: Hello, I was adding highscores following this guide "https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?topic=364364.0" but when I got down too this "http://localhost/security/xamppsecurity.php" nothing showed up it was just white and it was the same for "http://localhost/highscores/highscores.php" idk if it's because of me changing my port or what but I need help please.

item.title: Highscores on website
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

[quote=“my-swagger, post:5, topic:554202”][quote author=Lothy link=topic=673126.msg4501332#msg4501332 date=1451054188]
It’s not that it’s not running - the white screen (as opposed to HTTP error code) is pretty telling; just check your apache logs.
[/quote]
I get a blank screen instead of a HTTP error. I’m not running xamp or any other webserver. I’m using Firefox.

Try opening the link he posted, what results do you get?[/quote]
The URL he provided is using the localhost loopback address. I get a 404 because there’s nothing there - I have no web server running/listening on port 80.
I’m using Google Chrome, but Firefox should present a 404 too.

On the other hand, if there’s a file that the web server is trying to run with PHP - but it can’t read that file on disk - then the error code likely won’t be 404.

Read full topic

item.title: Highscores on website
item.dc:creator: @my-swagger my-swagger
item.description:
@my-swagger wrote:

Lothy:

It’s not that it’s not running - the white screen (as opposed to HTTP error code) is pretty telling; just check your apache logs.

I get a blank screen instead of a HTTP error. I’m not running xamp or any other webserver. I’m using Firefox.

Try opening the link he posted, what results do you get?

Read full topic

It’s not that it’s not running - the white screen (as opposed to HTTP error code) is pretty telling; just check your apache logs.

item.title: Highscores on website
item.dc:creator: @my-swagger my-swagger
item.description:
@my-swagger wrote:

Check you’re running xamp

Read full topic

item.title: Highscores on website
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Have you checked your file system permissions for the directories that website files are stored in? I’m not sure of the precise requirements but Apache and PHP will probably need a mix of read/write/execute permissions in various places.

You’re using XAMPP, which uses Apache, so look for the Apache logs and read through to see what’s going wrong (hint: refresh the page and then check the log entries at the time you hit refresh).

Read full topic

item.title: Highscores on website

item.description:
@tank_nation wrote:

Hello,
I was adding highscores following this guide “https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?topic=364364.0” but when I got down too this “http://localhost/security/xamppsecurity.php” nothing showed up it was just white and it was the same for “http://localhost/highscores/highscores.php” idk if it’s because of me changing my port or what but I need help please.
